title: Tracking Issue for inline assembly (`asm!`)

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: B-unstable
labels.description: Implemented in the nightly compiler and unstable.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

labels.name: WG-embedded
labels.description: Of interest to the embedded Working Group

labels.name: disposition-merge
labels.description: This issue / PR is in PFCP or FCP with a disposition to merge it.

labels.name: finished-final-comment-period
labels.description: The final comment period is finished for this PR / Issue.

body:
This is a tracking issue for the RFC 2873 (rust-lang/rfcs#2873).
The feature gate for the issue is `#![feature(asm)]`.

### Stabilization

- ~~Blockers: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72016#issuecomment-761616910~~
- ~~Blockers: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72016#issuecomment-819519824~~
- Stabilization report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72016#issuecomment-964186287

### Steps

- [x] Implement the RFC (#69171)
- [x] LLVM version check (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/69171#issuecomment-629700314, #76738)
- [x] Adjust documentation ([see instructions on rustc-dev-guide][doc-guide])
- [ ] Stabilization PR ([see instructions on rustc-dev-guide][stabilization-guide])

[stabilization-guide]: https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/stabilization_guide.html#stabilization-pr
[doc-guide]: https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/stabilization_guide.html#documentation-prs

### Implementation history

- #69171 Initial implementation
